Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Whenever L.A. city or county or Chicago or New York do something bold like this, it’s a really important signal that this big policy idea found its footing during COVID and represents a possible way forward in terms of supporting low income people across America,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “If you knew the money was coming for three years, it’s a much longer runway. Can you go back to school? Can you quit your job now and look for a new one? Can you care for your aging parents?”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “There is so much we don’t know yet,” “We don’t know how long people need to receive cash to create what level of change.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It can’t just be the money,” “It’s the opportunity and the access to experiences sometimes that really make a big difference when there is even a little bit more resources folks can have. ”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: oversees the program coaches at Strength Based Community Change

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I didn’t expect to be accepted,” “When I was, I was really, really pleasantly surprised. It definitely took the edge off.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I’m probably getting more comfortable with spending money,” “Just learning to say yes to stuff. There’s some stuff that, at the beginning of the program I felt was, you know, almost extravagant. And now I’m like ‘Oh my god, I really needed that for my business to move forward.’”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: one of 1,000 participants in L.A. County’s guaranteed income program, called Breathe

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “People need help with normal, everyday interactions that may be easy for some individuals,” “But for others, they don’t have any prior experience with them.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: coach for program participants; provided through Wilmington-based Strength Based Community Change

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Researchers at the University of Pennsylvania are surveying the 1,000 Breathe participants, along with a control group of people not receiving funds.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: researchers at the University of Pennsylvania

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Stanford Guaranteed Income Lab tracks 31 pilot programs throughout the country, including the Breathe pilot.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: tracks 31 pilot programs throughout the country, including the Breathe pilot

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Strength Based Community Change also offers workshops on financial literacy, investing and credit repair.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: offers workshops on financial literacy, investing and credit repair
